DOC.brief_summary: The overall aim project determine whether exercise influence cardiovascular nervous response meal ingestion individual insulin resistance type 2 diabetes .
DOC.brief_title: Acute Cardiovascular Metabolic Effects Exercise Training Individuals With Insulin Resistance
DOC.detailed_description: Participants undergo screen procedure , include telephone screen physical examination , well determination body composition fitness . Participants ask complete 5-10 day supervise exercise training undergo test assess cardiovascular metabolic responses oral glucose tolerance test , include muscle sympathetic nerve activity , blood flow , circulate glucose insulin concentration baseline follow training . In addition , day-to-day variation blood glucose also monitor . The overall aim project determine whether acute exercise training influence postprandial metabolic , vascular autonomic nervous system responses individual insulin resistance T2D .
DOC.criteria: Insulin resistant : diagnose prediabetes fast blood glucose > /= 100 mg/dL T2D : diagnose primary care physician BMI : less 43 kg/m2 Age : 3065 Smoking Insulin use ( daily ) Underlying condition limit ability exercise safely Recent weight gain loss ( > 5 % body weight 3 month ) Physically active ( > 30 min aerobic exercise , 2 d/wk ) Recent ( < 3 mo ) change medication use dose Uncontrolled T2D ( HbA1c > 10 % ) Advanced retinopathy neuropathy Pregnancy
